intro: Cardiolepis, commonly known as the "heart-leaved" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves, which are usually opposite or alternate in arrangement. Cardiolepis species are native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Africa and southern Asia. They thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
